tip: Always trust your instincts and intuition.
Stay aware of your surroundings, especially in unfamiliar places.
Avoid walking alone at night, especially in poorly lit or isolated areas.
If possible, walk in well-lit and populated areas.
Share your location with a trusted friend or family member when going out alone.
Trust your instincts if someone makes you feel uncomfortable, and leave the situation if necessary.
Keep your phone charged and easily accessible for emergency calls.
Carry a personal safety alarm or whistle to attract attention if needed.
Avoid wearing headphones or using your phone while walking, as it can distract you from your surroundings.
Be cautious when accepting drinks from strangers and never leave your drink unattended.
